concept.title: Decentralized Control

othermeta.name: shortdesc
othermeta.content: Explains the UPS decentralized control architecture, including communication between modules, redundancy features, and distributed control logic.

conbody.p: The individual controllers and boards are supplied by one internal 24 V DC power supply unit (PSU) (A), supplied from the battery DC bus. The static switch controller and the monitoring controller has a redundant internal 24 V DC PSU (B), supplied from the bypass AC mains. As an option it is possible to have an additional redundant supply to the PSU (B) from the rectifier AC mains.
The intercommunication between the controllers and boards are done over a CAN-bus (C), the CAN-bus cables are always white.

The display (D) communicates (E) with the monitoring controller (G), the display cable is always blue. In case additional relays or inputs/outputs are needed, an additional board can be added to the monitoring controller.

The fan monitoring board (F) controls the transformer fans. The transformer fans are demand controlled and will adjust their speed, depending on the measured temperatures. One board can monitor up to six fans, if more fans needs to be monitored a second board is used.

Each power module (rectifier, inverter, static switch) has its own controller (H),(I),(J). Each controller also controls the power module fans. The power module fans are also demand controlled and will adjust their speed, depending on the measured temperatures.
The power module controllers also has a sync bus (K) that helps to ensure that the voltages are in sync. The sync bus cables are always green.
conbody.note: An asterisk (*) indicates additions or options, depending on the system configuration.
